intro: Onosma maracandica, commonly known as the Persian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, aiding in water retention. Onosma maracandica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
